abstract.p: Ralph M Schapira letter on elaborate high school proms; indicts parents who encourage materialism (S)

block.p: ''Grand Night for Splurging: Boom Times Make Prom an Event on Which No Expense Is Spared'' (news article, June 16) states that prosperity is fueling the prom social scene, with its shocking extravagance. Rather, the need to have one's children mark the end of high school in this way reflects a breakdown in the priorities of parents who encourage and provide an extreme level of materialism that appears to be devoid of social and moral value.

''Grand Night for Splurging: Boom Times Make Prom an Event on Which No Expense Is Spared'' (news article, June 16) states that prosperity is fueling the prom social scene, with its shocking extravagance. Rather, the need to have one's children mark the end of high school in this way reflects a breakdown in the priorities of parents who encourage and provide an extreme level of materialism that appears to be devoid of social and moral value.

The fact that some parents send their children to recover in the Hamptons after a prom makes one question the values with which we are imbuing our children. I shudder as I contemplate the expectations of these children as they have their own.
